result.execSummary:
The defendant Raymond J Clippard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery of a Financial Institution, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.
  • Robbery of a Financial Institution, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.
  • Robbery of a Financial Institution, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCAIL OBLIGATIONS:  To be paid out of up to 25% prison funds. Any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for 219 days.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.
Mental health assessment.  Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.
No contact with the victims:  Christine H., Matthew S., Joseph C., Family Dollar located on W. Burleigh St., US Bank (all), Chase Bank located on W. Capitol Drive.
Alcohol and drug assessment.  Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.  No positive results.

supervisions.notes: AS TO ALL COUNTS:  conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by DOC, but to include: those as listed.

Submit a DNA sample.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms/body armor or weapons. Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for zero days.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence. Credit for zero days.
***Defendant does qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 11 years Initial Confinement in this case.

records.addlTxt: per order dated April 10, 2017, Appeal No. 2017XX516-CR, IT IS ORDERED that the time for filing a notice of appeal or postconviction motion is extended to June 6, 2017.

Defendant Raymond J Clippard in court with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.  Defendant Raymond J Clippard in custody.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 6 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 4 years with credit for 219 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 years.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample and pay the mandatory DNA surcharge, if not already done, out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

AS TO COUNTS 4 & 5:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 6 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 4 years with credit for 0 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 years.

- Court ordered no DNA sample or DNA surcharge as it has been ordered on count 3.

AS TO ALL COUNTS:
Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:

*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with the victims:  Christine H., Matthew S., Joseph C., Family Dollar located on W. Burleigh St., US Bank (all), Chase Bank located on W. Capitol Dr.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Restitution is ordered in the amount of $2100.00 to be paid to US Bank.

- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms/body armour or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs, surcharges and restitution, out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

- Defendant does not qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program but does qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 11 years initial confinement in this case.

Appeal rights given.  
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
filed.

Jury trial is vacated.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-28-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Raymond J Clippard in court with Attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.  Defendant Raymond J Clippard in custody.  Dax Odom, appearing for Benjamin Andrew Wesson, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant sworn as to his statements.

As to Counts 3, 4 and 5:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  

As to Counts 1 and 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court orders Counts 1 and 2  DISMISSED, but read-in as to sentencing.

No PSI ordered.  Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 21.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.

Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Raymond J Clippard in court with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.  Defendant Raymond J Clippard in custody.  Jacob Daniel Corr and Benjamin Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant filed pro se motions without notifying parties.  Court ordered case adjourned for Final pretrial conference and jury trial.  Court ordered motions be filed by Final pretrial date.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Notice Of Motion and Motion To Dismiss
Notice of Motion and Motion to Dismiss filed.

Notice of Motion and Motion to Dismiss

Attorney Joseph Edward Schubert in court, defendant Raymond J Clippard not in court, in custody.  Maureen Ami Atwell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Motion hearing scheduled for 06-25-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Joseph Edward Schubert in court, Defendant Raymond J Clippard not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not produced for purposes of this hearing. Defense newly appointed.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Raymond J Clippard in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Defendant Raymond J Clippard in custody.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Hackbart informs court that there has been a breakdown in communication that is irreconcilable.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Attorney is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed.  Case is adjourned for status of counsel.  Court declines to hear bail motion at this time.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FROM THE HOUSE OF CORRECTION FOR PURPOSES OF THE PROJECTED GUILTY PLEA HEARING IN BRANCH 26.

Attorney Thomas K. Hackbart in court, defendant Raymond J Clippard not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not produced from the House of Correction for purposes of this hearing.   Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Court ordered the bail to remain as is.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed with court.

Defendant Raymond J Clippard in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Defendant Raymond J Clippard in custody.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defense motion to dismiss COUNTS 3, 4 and 5 are reviewed by the Court and denied at this time.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.   
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia or no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Family Dollar and David H.; U.S. Bank, Matthew H and Joseph C.; Chase Bank and Christine H.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Raymond J Clippard in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  
Defendant Raymond J Clippard in custody.  
Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. 
Defense moves to dismiss COUNTS  1, 3, 4, 5 of the complaint for lack of probable cause. Arguments heard.  Court DENIES defense motion to dismiss complaint.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Defendant pleads Not Guilty as to Count 1 ( Misdemeanor).
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
